bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, February 29, 1916

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to attend a conference on immigrant health inspections.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, February 29, 1916
div1.opener:
JKC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WMT
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
February 29, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon-General Henry R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
The Commissioner-General of Immigration has re-
quested that the medical officers in charge at Boston,
New York, Philadelphia, and Baltimore be ordered to
Washington to attend a conference to be held at the
Immigration Bureau, Department of Labor, upon athe sub-
ject of inspection of second cabin passengers under
the immigration laws.

You are therefore directed to report at this
Bureau Friday morning, March 3, 1916, about 10 o'clock
A.M., preliminary to the conference to be held at the
Immigration Bureau at two o'clock of the same day.

Upon completion of this duty you will return to
your station at Baltimore, Maryland.

It is understood that the expenses incurred under
this order will be paid from funds under the control of
the Immigration Bureau.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue,
Surgeon-General. AHG
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
B R Newton
Assistant Secretary.
R B
